findings.title: Potentially unlimited indemnification
findings.rationale: Indemnity obligations may be uncapped, which can expose you to costs far beyond the contract value.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY Provider's liability for indemnification claims is unlimited and not subject to any cap....
findings.context:
ights.

4. INDEMNIFICATION
Provider shall defend and indemnify Client from all third-party claims, without limitation, arising from Provider's services.

5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
Provider's liability for indemnification claims is unlimited and not subject to any cap.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Client may terminate immediately. Provider requires 60 days notice.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY
Confidentiality survives termina

findings.title: Confidentiality may be perpetual / indefinite
findings.rationale: Indefinite confidentiality can create long-term compliance burden and uncertainty around retention and disclosure.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...7. CONFIDENTIALITY Confidentiality survives termination and continues in perpetuity....
findings.exact_snippet: CONFIDENTIALITY Confidentiality survives termination and continues in perpetuity
findings.context:
MITATION OF LIABILITY
Provider's liability for indemnification claims is unlimited and not subject to any cap.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Client may terminate immediately. Provider requires 60 days notice.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY
Confidentiality survives termination and continues in perpetuity.

8. WARRANTIES
Provider warrants that all services meet industry standards and comply with specifications.

findings.title: Specific governing law or venue
findings.rationale: Governing law and venue choices can affect enforcement cost and strategy.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...10. GOVERNING LAW This Agreement is governed by California law, without regard to conflict of law principles....
findings.context:
s that all services meet industry standards and comply with specifications.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
All disputes must be resolved through binding arbitration under AAA rules.

10. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement is governed by California law, without regard to conflict of law principles.

11. ATTORNEYS' FEES
Client is entitled to recover all attorneys' fees and costs in any action to enforce this Agreement.

12. MODIFICATIONS

findings.title: Late fees / high interest
findings.rationale: Penalty terms can increase costs if payment timing slips.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...2. PAYMENT TERMS Payment is due net 30 days. Interest accrues at 1.5% per month on overdue amounts....
findings.context:
Service Provider ("Provider") and Client Company ("Client").

1. SERVICES
Provider agrees to provide the services described in attached Statements of Work.

2. PAYMENT TERMS
Payment is due net 30 days. Interest accrues at 1.5% per month on overdue amounts.

3. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
All deliverables become the exclusive property of Client upon final payment. Provider waives all moral rights.

4. INDEMNIFICATION
Provider

changes: Added 8 high-signal rules (attorneys fees, liability cap carveouts, assignment restrictions, etc.)
Implemented clause-level anchoring and false-positive suppression
